result.execSummary:
The defendant Tinette E Weatherall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cost to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09-01-2015, alternate of 5 days Jail if not paid.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact with:  Co-Actors or with Kohl's on Appleton Avenue in Menomonee Falls.
Take Criminal Thinking  Course.
Take Victim Impact Course.
Obtain a valid driver's license within the First 60 days of Probation.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time: 30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.
To be completed by the end of the 10th Month of Probation.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tinette E Weatherall in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

8  MONTHS HUBER  - 1ST 60 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors or with Kohls on Appleton Avenue in Menomonee Falls
____Criminal Thinking course
____Victim impact course
____Obtain a valid driver's license within 1st 60 days of probation
____20 Hours of Community Service-to be completed by end of 10th month of probation


COSTS:  $258.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 9/1/15, alternate 5 days jail if not paid) to be paid as a condition of probation.

CONDITION TIME: 30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 6/30/15 at 12:00 p.m. forthwith.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tinette E Weatherall in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty. Kershek requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
